author: Deric Phillips
subject: Re: web.archive.org - slightly off-topic
body:
Hi.  I wanna know how to recover the Good Marksman game too.  I loved that 
game and they took it from me.  How can I reclaim the ooey gooey goodness?  
Please help!


>From: cruzl@ccs.neu.edu (Luis Cruz)
>Reply-To: lupin AT mcs DOT kent DOT edu
>To: lupin AT mcs DOT kent DOT edu (Lupin_ML)
>Subject: [lupin] web.archive.org - slightly off-topic
>Date: Wed, 23 Jan 2002 16:12:52 -0500 (EST)
>
>Thought I would share this; web.archive.org is a _very_ large database
>of web sites throughout the life of the WWW.  I trolled around and found
>that it had very old versions of the Lupin FAQ on it.
>
>It also has old versions of monkeypunch.com and other anime sites.  The
>archive of each site can be spotty at times; sometimes certain images
>won't come up or certain links will go nowhere.  But, if you can read/write
>HTML, you can save off long-forgotten pages off of your favorite web sites.
>
>I personally have recovered the "Good Marksman?" game that used to be
>up on monkeypunch.com.  Throw in some old URLs of your own or friend's
>pages and see what comes up.
>
>Cheers.
>
>--
>Luis A. Cruz
>cruzl@ccs.neu.edu
>Lupin III Encyclopedia:  http://www.lupinencyclopedia.com/
>Anime Video Game Resource Center:  http://www.lupinencyclopedia.com/avrc/
